tagline: Builds fault-tolerant systems on the BEAM — where crashes are safe, recovery is automatic, and uptime is architecture
pros: BEAM-native fault tolerance with supervision trees and process isolation
Real-time capabilities with Phoenix LiveView and Channels
Distributed systems by default — node clustering and message passing built in
Elegant concurrency without locks, shared state, or data races
cons: Smaller ecosystem and talent pool than mainstream languages
BEAM's CPU performance is limited for computation-heavy workloads
Paradigm shift from OOP can slow team onboarding significantly

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
